FuncDef:
The test-session bind interface command binds an interface to a TWAMP Light test session.
The undo test-session bind interface command unbinds an interface from a TWAMP Light test session.
By default, no interface is bound to a TWAMP Light test session.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a test session.
For the X3 device, the value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3072.For the X8/X16 device, the value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8192.

Specifies the type of an interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the number of an interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the name of an interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To bind an interface to a TWAMP Light test session, run the test-session bind interface command. After an interface is bound to a TWAMP Light test session and TWAMP Light discovers valid statistics, TWAMP Light advertises the statistics (including the remote IP address, maximum delay, minimum delay, and average delay) to the interface. Other functional modules can use these statistics to implement more service applications. For example, an IGP can obtain the statistics from the interface and report them to the Controller for path computation. In this case, the outbound interface of the route needs to be bound to the test session.
Prerequisites
A TWAMP Light test session has been created.
Precautions
The TWAMP Light test session can be of the IPv4 or IPv6 type.
TWAMP Light advertises test statistics to the bound interface after discovering valid statistics only when the test start-continual or test start twamp-regular command is configured.
A TWAMP Light test session can be bound to only one interface, and an interface is bound to a maximum of one IPv4 test session and one IPv6 test session.
